subject: Sales
title: What Never Changes in Selling
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Never Changes in Selling.

hook.text: From Mesopotamian bazaars to modern SaaS demos, one truth has survived every era of commerce.

buildup.text: Technology evolves each decade. Channels shift every few years. But buyer psychology stays constant.

discovery.text: People still buy on trust, emotion, and perceived value â€” the same forces as five thousand years ago.

twist.text: Every generation believes selling has fundamentally changed. They're always wrong about the core.

climax.text: Master the timeless basics: understand needs, earn trust, show value. Everything else is just fashion.

punchline.text: Tools change. Human nature never does.

quiz.question: What has remained constant throughout the history of selling?
options: Buyer psychology: trust, emotion, and perceived value
